result.title: Report on analysis of interactions among the mesopelagic community and with predators
result.description: Description and analysis of the trophic niche overlap and partition among the key species within each meso and bathypelagic communities for each case study locations where stable isotope data are availableEstimation of the annual energy and biomass removals by top predators mainly cetaceans and seabirds of major mesopelagic prey groups from the different European marine subregions The analysis will combine relative proportions and energetic densities of ingested prey as well as predator energetic requirements and population sizes

result.title: Global and regionally-constrained biomass from models
result.description: We will use the ecosystem model APECOSM to simulate the globalscale dynamics of the mesopelagic communities on a 3D numerical grid with a 1 horizontal resolution over the period 19482016 Acoustic observations will be used to refine parameters estimates and assess the models predictions Global mesopelagic biomass predicted by APECOSM will be compared to the empirical estimates available in the literature

result.title: Database of new and existing diet/trophic level data of key mesopelagic species and predators and of nutritional quality of mesopelagic organisms
result.description: The analysis of new samples in combination to historical studies will supply information to build a database on the main trophic links of key mesopelagic species and their predators, and on the nutritional quality of mesopelagic organisms.

result.title: SUMMER background knowledge available in open access
result.description: Open access collection of background available for SUMMER. Literature, data, maps and model outputs relevant to mesopelagic zone ecosystem-based research will be collected and made available to SUMMER partners. Access and availability will be facilitated using existing open science resources.
